channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: “To determine the coloring of the ancient statues, Brinkmann and Koch-Brinkmann applied both scientific techniques and art historical research.” https://t.co/UwWDTupWwp
@trekonomics To be fair, that’s true of most fields.
And people didn’t believe online relationships were real…. https://t.co/EY8Ta2yIso

“I believe this one wake up call justifies the hundreds of emails I have to delete each and every day.” —My Beloved Conservative Relative, forwarding Bari Weiss’s latest
I guess it’s time for me to go through my hundreds of emails documenting BW’s mendacity.
Again, the fact that the billion dollar Democratic Party operation is yelling at “activists” rather than writing actual talking points refuting BW and the other reactionary grifters is a huge honking problem.

@trekonomics The problem is the demand he’s filling. CEOs who don’t trust themselves or their staff to predict the future.
@trekonomics Ultimately, these are the same people who keep looking to Kissinger for advice. Harari may be facile, but at least he’s not a big time war criminal.
@datadivajf At Barnes & Noble?
@theREALMikeDunn @joshtpm I think he has a legit claim that he has so sabotaged his reputation since April that he can no longer get financing.
@roryjmartin @trekonomics But Elon doesn’t have 44 bn and his Tesla stock has arguably peaked, at least unless he walks away from the business.
@nberlat Doesn’t sound all that different than certain readings of Job.
@michaelharriot “The Coasts”
@joshtpm Mars is precisely the kind of place to dodge a process server.
@frumfollies @fordm That’s why the reports stressed steak, which I assume was on the Colonial menu. I checked and potatoes seem to have been widely cultivated in the Colonies by the 1750s.
“stop tweeting about the death camps, now Hitler’s not returning my calls on background.” https://t.co/cqgvHZX61a
@devon_spier I drank more coffee. And reverted to soda when I stopped taking the medicine.

@devon_spier I took something to (successfully) lower my spinal fluid pressure. It made every carbonated beverage taste horrible. I was a major Diet Coke drinker and I just couldn’t any more.
@devon_spier It was more unnerving that the bad effects the labels warn you about, because those are just standard body breakdown modes. The notion that the flavor of carbonation is contingent, however….

I’d like to thank all my Republican and conservative friends for helping make my life and that of my children less safe once again — and the various Orthodox theologians who used spurious logic to convince them that ultimately No Lives Matter because God will even the score. https://t.co/GIFm4zn9WP
@EladNehorai Ultimately a demand-side problem.
@DBashIdeas @DansDeals I guess there is now….

@dick_nixon Sir, is there any case where the party of a disgraced caretaker PM wins the next election regardless? My parliamentary knowledge is limited to Israel. A variation of this scenario was a historical disaster for Rabin in 77.
@AD_Lobel Got your Carpenters right here. https://t.co/QdXwSIz9hc
@FeldheimRejects I think this premise works better as a movie.
@tompeyer I’ve had lots of day like that despite no hypnosis.
@MisfitTorah You didn’t realize that Alito is trying to save you from a Bolshevik hellhole?
